file_name: PlayboyEnterprisesInc_20090220_10-QA_EX-10.2_4091580_EX-10.2_Content License Agreement_ Marketing Agreement_ Sales-Purchase Agreement1.pdf

perturbation.original_text: Client is in the business of, inter alia, developing, marketing, promoting, distributing and selling branded and unbranded merchandise via physical media, worldwide, via mail order catalogs (the “Catalogs”) where orders are taken via multiple order channels including online, phone, fax and mail and via the Internet through its PLAYBOY-branded and BUNNY SHOP-branded e-commerce websites as designated on Exhibit 1 (the “Websites”) (the Catalogs and Websites shall be collectively referred to as the “Playboy Commerce Business”).
perturbation.changed_text: Client is in the business of, inter alia, developing, marketing, promoting, distributing and selling branded and unbranded merchandise via physical media, worldwide, via mail order catalogs (the “Playboy Printed Media”) where orders are taken via multiple order channels including online, phone, fax and mail and via the Internet through its PLAYBOY-branded and BUNNY SHOP-branded e-commerce websites as designated on Exhibit 1 (the “Digital Platforms”) (the Playboy Printed Media and Digital Platforms shall be collectively referred to as the “Playboy Business Ventures”).
perturbation.explanation: The original text uses 'Catalogs' and 'Websites' which are collectively referred to as the 'Playboy Commerce Business'. The modified version replaces these terms with 'Playboy Printed Media' and 'Digital Platforms', collectively 'Playboy Business Ventures'. This creates confusion as it is now unclear whether 'Playboy Business Ventures' includes the same elements as 'Playboy Commerce Business', especially regarding obligations tied to each term in later sections.

perturbation.original_text: EFS agrees to staff the Playboy Commerce Business sufficiently to operate and grow the Playboy Commerce Business. An initial organizational chart approved by both parties is attached as Exhibit 6, attached hereto and hereby incorporated by reference. EFS agrees to employ certain individuals who are currently employed by the Client (names, titles and current salaries are listed in Exhibit 6), the hiring of whom shall be complete no later than March 1, 2008.
perturbation.changed_text: EFS agrees to staff the Digital Platforms sufficiently to operate and grow the Playboy Commerce Business. An initial organizational chart approved by both parties is attached as Exhibit 6, attached hereto and hereby incorporated by reference. EFS agrees to employ certain individuals who are currently employed by the Client (names, titles and current salaries are listed in Exhibit 6), the hiring of whom shall be complete no later than March 1, 2008.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that EFS must staff the 'Playboy Commerce Business', however the modified version says to staff the 'Digital Platforms' but still states it will operate and grow the 'Playboy Commerce Business'. This introduces a contradiction, implying different staffing requirements for the different terms used interchangeably.

perturbation.original_text: Client grants EFS the right to: (a) sell and place on the Websites promotional banner advertisements (the frequency, placement and volume of which to be mutually agreed upon by the parties) that advertise and market third party products and services that do not compete with Client’s products or services and comply with Client’s advertising guidelines (“Advertisements”), provided that such advertising efforts are mutual (i.e., equivalent promotion of Client and its affiliates on third party websites) and are executed in a manner that minimizes adverse impact on sales; and (b) send emails containing Advertisements to customers who specifically opt in to receive email notifications from EFS and Client. All Advertisements on the Websites and emails to Playboy Commerce Business customers will require the prior written consent of Client (which will not be unreasonably withheld or delayed).
perturbation.changed_text: Client grants EFS the right to: (a) sell and place on the Digital Platforms promotional banner advertisements (the frequency, placement and volume of which to be mutually agreed upon by the parties) that advertise and market third party products and services that do not compete with Client’s products or services and comply with Client’s advertising guidelines (“Advertisements”), provided that such advertising efforts are mutual (i.e., equivalent promotion of Client and its affiliates on third party websites) and are executed in a manner that minimizes adverse impact on sales; and (b) send emails containing Advertisements to customers who specifically opt in to receive email notifications from EFS and Client. All Advertisements on the Websites and emails to Playboy Commerce Business customers will require the prior written consent of Client (which will not be unreasonably withheld or delayed).
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Websites' is changed to 'Digital Platforms', but then the agreement also mentions 'All Advertisements on the Websites'. Because the initial definitions in the file are contradictary, it makes it difficult to know the extent of both of the terms. Thus, it becomes unclear whether the obligation pertains specifically to the Digital Platforms and Websites or if the scope is actually different from the original intent.
